intro: Faramea maynensis, commonly known as the Jamaican wax tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean, particularly Jamaica, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, compound leaves, and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Faramea maynensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of interest in ecological studies.
